oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Indian Creek Missionary Baptist Church: front view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Indian Creek Missionary Baptist Church and Cemetery

Color photograph of a white panel church built in two sections -- the main sanctuary building and a shed-roofed addition. The primary building has a cupola but no steeple and a double entry door. The addition has a single entry door. A porch roof covers both entrances. A sign propped agains the building reads "Welcome to Indian Creek M.B. Church..." A headstone in the related cemetery is visible at left in background.

Indian Creek Missionary Baptist Church is a Reconstruction-era church. Date unknown. The cemetery is on a steep hillside and contains graves of U.S. Colored Troops veterans, among several other 19th century burials.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
Churches
